gdt.data.entity

Class ArchiveHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • gdt.data.entity.ArchiveHandler

  • public class ArchiveHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains methods to process archive files
    Since:
    2016-03-11
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Alexander Imas

    • Method Detail

      • getLocator

        public java.lang.String getLocator()
        Build the set of arguments needed to create an instance of ArchiveHandler and pack them in the special string parameter - locator.
        Returns:
        The locator string.

      • detectTypeOfArchive

        public static java.lang.String detectTypeOfArchive(java.lang.String fname$)
        Discover the type of the archive file.
        Parameters:
        fname$ - the name of the file.
        Returns:
        ARCHIVE_TYPE_TAR for *.tar file, ARCHIVE_TYPE_TGZ for *.tar.gz file ARCHIVE_TYPE_ZIP for *.zip file and null otherwise.

      • detectContentOfArchive

        public static java.lang.String detectContentOfArchive(java.lang.String file$)
        Discover the type of content within the archive file.
        Parameters:
        file$ - the path of the archive.
        Returns:
        ARCHIVE_CONTENT_DATABASE if the file contains a database, ARCHIVE_CONTENT_ENTITIES if the file contains a set of entities and null otherwise.

      • compressDatabaseToTar

        public boolean compressDatabaseToTar(Entigrator entigrator,
                                     java.lang.String locator$)
        Compress the database into the tar archive file.
        Parameters:
        entigrator - entigrator instance, locator$ container of arguments in the string form.
        Returns:
        true if success false otherwise.

        Returns:

      • insertCache

        public static java.lang.String[] insertCache(Entigrator entigrator,
                                             java.lang.String cache$,
                                             boolean keep)
        Insert entities from the cache directory into the database.
        Parameters:
        entigrator - entigrator instance
        cache$ - directory path
        keep - boolean value. If keep is true then keep existing entities. If keep is false then replace existing entities.
        Returns:
        array of keys of inserted entities.

      • insertEntities

        public static java.lang.String insertEntities(JMainConsole console,
                                              java.lang.String entihome$,
                                              java.lang.String file$)
        Insert entities from the archive file into the database.
        Parameters:
        console - main console instance
        entihome$ - the root directory of the database
        file$ - the path of the archive file.
        Returns:
        the key of 'undo' entity.
